verses.text: 奉 神旨意作基督耶穌使徒的保羅，和提摩太弟兄，寫信給在哥林多 神的教會，和全亞該亞所有的聖徒。

words.note: More formal than 'by' or 'according to'
The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.
Often used for God's will.
Lit. 'sent disciple'
Used for 'brother' in general, or fellow Christians.
The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.
Lit. 'teaching assembly'
Lit. 'holy disciple'

verses.heading: Salutation

verses.text: 願恩惠平安從我們的父 神和主耶穌基督臨到你們。

words.note: Commonly paired with '平安' (peace) in biblical greetings.
Used as an address for God.
The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.
Used as a title for God or Christ.

verses.text: 神賜安慰我們主耶穌基督的父 神是應當稱頌的。他是滿有憐憫的父，賜各樣安慰的 神。

words.note: The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.
Formal word for 'give', often from a superior.
Used as a title for God or Christ.
Used as an address for God.
The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.
Forms an adjectival phrase 'that which should be praised'.
Used as an address for God.
Formal word for 'give', often from a superior.
The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.

verses.heading: Thanksgiving for God’s Comfort

verses.text: 我們在一切患難中， 神都安慰我們，使我們能用他所賜的安慰，去安慰那些在各樣患難中的人。

words.note: Often follows a noun to indicate 'in the midst of'.
The preceding space is a common honorific in Chinese Bibles.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb, e.g., 'that which is given'.
Formal word for 'give', often from a superior.
Often indicates purpose or subsequent action.
Often follows a noun to indicate 'in the midst of'.

verses.text: 我們既然多受基督所受的痛苦，就靠著基督多得安慰。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb, indicating passive voice or object.
Indicates a consequence or result.

verses.text: 如果我們遭遇患難，那是要使你們得著安慰，得著拯救；如果我們得到安慰，也是要使你們得到安慰。這安慰使你們能夠忍受我們所受那樣的痛苦。

words.note: Common in biblical texts for 'affliction' or 'distress'.
A key theological term for 'salvation'.
Often indicates passive or highlights the object of the verb.

verses.text: 我們對你們的盼望是堅定的，因為知道你們既然一同受痛苦，也必照樣同得安慰。
弟兄們，我們在亞西亞遭受的患難，我們很想讓你們知道。那時我們受到了過於我們所能忍受的壓力，甚至活下去的希望都沒有了，

words.note: Common address for fellow believers in Christian contexts.
Common in biblical texts for 'affliction' or 'distress'.
Often indicates passive or highlights the object of the verb.

verses.text: 而且斷定自己是必死的了；然而，這正是要我們不倚靠自己，只倚靠那叫死人復活的 神。

words.note: A central concept in Christian theology.
Capitalized when referring to the Christian God.

verses.text: 他救我們脫離了那極大的死亡，而且他還要救我們，我們希望他將來仍要救我們。
請你們一同用禱告支持我們，好使許多人為著我們所蒙的恩獻上感謝。這恩是藉著許多人的代求而得到的。

words.note: A common verb-object compound.
Indicates the following verb is passive or is the object of the clause.
Often used for receiving grace or blessings.
Forms a descriptive clause or emphasizes the verb.

verses.text: 我們引以為榮的，就是我們處世為人，是本著 神的聖潔和真誠，不是靠著人的聰明，而是靠著 神的恩典，對你們更是這樣，這是我們的良心可以作證的。

words.definition: take pride in, be proud of
words.note: A set phrase meaning 'to consider something as an honor'.
A set phrase describing one's behavior in society.
Often preceded by an honorific space (　) in Chinese Bibles.
Often preceded by an honorific space (　) in Chinese Bibles.
Forms a descriptive clause or emphasizes the verb.

verses.heading: Paul Defends His Changed Plans

verses.text: 我們現在寫給你們的，不外是你們可以宣讀、可以明白的。

words.note: Turns a phrase into a nominal phrase ('that which is written to you').
Forms a descriptive clause or emphasizes the verb.

verses.text: 正如你們對我們已經有些認識，我盼望你們可以徹底明白：在我們的主耶穌的日子，我們是你們的光榮，你們也是我們的光榮。
我既然有這樣的信念，就打算先到你們那裡，使你們再一次得到恩惠，
然後經過你們那裡，往馬其頓去，再從馬其頓回到你們中間，讓你們給我送行往猶太去。
我這樣決定，難道是反覆不定嗎？我所決定的，難道是體貼肉體而定，使我忽是忽非嗎？

words.note: Used to introduce rhetorical questions.
Indicates the following verb's action has a stated object.
Used to introduce rhetorical questions.
Contextually 'indulge' (the flesh).

verses.text: 神是信實的，我們向你們所傳的道並不是「是」而又「非」的，

words.note: Indicates the following verb's action has a stated object.

verses.text: 因為我、西拉和提摩太，在你們中間所宣揚的耶穌基督， 神的兒子，並不是「是」而又「非」的，在他總是「是」的。

words.note: Indicates the following verb's action has a stated object.

verses.text: 因為 神的一切應許，在基督裡都是「是」的，為此我們藉著他說「阿們」，使榮耀歸於 神。

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew 'Amen'.

verses.text: 那在基督裡堅定我們和你們，又膏抹我們的，就是 神。

words.note: Specifically refers to the sacred act of anointing.
Refers to the Christian God.

verses.text: 他在我們身上蓋了印，就是賜聖靈在我們心裡作憑據。

words.note: More formal or archaic than 给 (gěi).
Refers to the third person of the Trinity.

verses.text: 我呼求 神給我作證，我沒有再到哥林多來，是要寬容你們。

words.note: Refers to the Christian God.

verses.heading: Why Paul Postponed His Visit

verses.text: 我們並不是要轄制你們的信仰，而是要作你們的同工，使你們喜樂，因為你們在信仰上已經站穩了。

words.note: More formal than control (控制); often implies restraint or coercion.
Commonly used in Christian contexts for ministry partners.
A key concept in Christian theology referring to spiritual joy.
